required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-PD-1 Antibody Combined With Anlotinib in the Treatment of Endometrial Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Single-arm, Phase II Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Anti-PD-1 Antibody Combined With Anlotinib in the Treatment of Recurrent or Advanced Endometrial Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the Efficacy and safety of Anti-PD-1 antibody combined With anlotinib in the treatment of recurrent or advanced endometrial cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Objective tumor response was defined as the proportion of patients whose tumor volume has been reduced to a predetermined value and can be maintained for more than 4 weeks, ie ORR=CR+PR.

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the time when the tumor is first evaluated as CR or PR to the first assessment for PD or for any cause of death.

Disease control rate was defined as the proportion of subjects with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) or disease stabilization (SD) in the analyzed population according to the RECIST 1.1 criteria.
Time to objective response was defined as the time from the start of treatment to the first objective tumor remission (CR or PR).
Progression-free survival was defined as the duration of time from study entry to time of progression, death, or the date of last contact, whichever occurs first.
Overall survival is defined as the duration of time from study entry to time of death or the date of last contact.
Overall survival rate at 12 months was defined as the proportion of patients who were still alive in 12 months.

intervention.description: Anti-PD-1 antibody administered by intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle plus Anlotinib 12 mg administered orally (PO) once daily (QD) Day1-Day14 during each 21-day cycle.
